feed.title: SAP Community - HCM (Human Capital Management)
feed.subtitle: HCM (Human Capital Management) Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Calculated columns: How to use TOTEXT for parameter with both string and number values
entry.content:
We are currently trying to set up a calculated column in SAP SuccessFactors People Analytics to determine eligibility for level progression using logic similar to the following
IF([Current Level] = "B3" AND [TIME_IN_LEVEL_MONTHS] >= 50 AND [TOTAL_SENIORITY_MONTHS] >= 150,
"B2",
[Current Level]
)


When referencing the parameter in the formula for [Current Level] , the error appears: Formula could not be computed: Function "=" expects parameters 1 and 2 to be of compatible types (found "Number" vs. "String"). Please complete or rewrite the formula.
--> The current level is recognized sometimes as text (A, A3, A3, ...) and sometimes as numbers (1, 2, 3, ...) which is true, the values can have both type of content.

To work around this, we attempted to use the TOTEXT() function to normalize the data type, but it seems this formula is more designed for dates? e.g. TOTEXT([Current Level#External Name]) like TOTEXT("A") "A" results in '17833043'

 


Could you advise on:

How to consistently treat [Current Level] as a text field in formulas?
Whether there’s a recommended approach for handling mixed-type fields in People Analytics?

Thank you in advance for your support.



Documentation reviewed:

  • https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_SUCCESSFACTORS_PEOPLE_ANALYTICS/dad69084edb947e98ebede671ecd26f0/190ee023528640478551fd4054e183bb.html?locale=en-US&state=PRODUCTION&version=2505
  • https://me.sap.com/notes/3204317

entry.title: Error en delegación de autorizaciones en portal de SAP
entry.content:
Hola ,

La empleada 11382 ha delegado las aprobaciones del portal en su manager 30780 ya que está de baja de maternidad. Al recibir la delegación de las aprobaciones, el manager 30780 deja de ver las peticiones de su subordinado directo 11382, no pudiendo realizar gestiones como lactancia, ... en el portal 

Regards

Sandeep Turkar

entry.title: Technical wagetype config
entry.content:
Hi SAP Experts, 

I have business requirement to display amount of 3 Wage types in to technical wage types.

I have created a custom WT Z101 using standard procedure, with processing class 1=0; PC 10=0; and PC 20= 3

i have write schema as well to show in RT: 

 

i have insert this in subschema XAL9 Factoring and Storage:

q.1 this technical WT is not displaying in RT table or payroll. what is the problem in this config?

q2. is it possible that we can add 3 amounts in single technical wage type through standard. or i need to create 3 different technical wage types for 3 different wage types.

SAP SuccessFactors HCM Core HCM (Human Capital Management) HCM Payroll SAP S/4HANA

entry.title: RAP Solution to update Absences (Infotype 2001)
entry.content:
In the context of Clean Core, we have started using RAP for all our API solutions. We have a requirement to update Absences (2001), Presence (2002) and Substitutions (2003). 

Currently known function modules to update Infotypes are "HR_MAINTAIN_MASTERDATA" and "HR_INFOTYPE_OPERATION". 

Unfortunately these function modules are not allowed in RAP since they make use of the statement CALL DIALOG.

Looked into the successor of "HR_MAINTAIN_MASTERDATA", CL_HRPA_MASTERDATA_BL. I do not find enough examples about how to use it for Infotypes 2001/2/3. 

Has anyone tried to work with Absences using RAP?

entry.title: Integrating timesheet/time tracking into Alternate Cost Distribution
entry.content: Can timesheet/time tracking be integrated into the Alternate Cost Distribution so that we can use it like Cross-Application Time Sheet(CATS)

entry.title: Unexpected Behavior with Team Filter in Peform Maintenance Jobs
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m encountering an issue with team management in  the "Manage Teams and Responsibilities for Work Centers" tile.

Context:

I’ve created a team using this app and assigned members to work centers. However, this setup has no impact on the filters used to view jobs associated with a team.

SAP Documentation:

According to the official documentation:

"If no work center has been specified in the Personalization app, the system considers the team defined in the Manage Teams and Responsibilities app."
(SAP Help Documentation)

So, in theory, if no default value is set in the Personalization app, the system should rely on the team definition from Manage Teams and Responsibilities. However, this doesn’t seem to work as expected:

  • If I use the Personalization App to set a Work Center, the job filter reacts properly.

  • If I remove the personalization and rely only on the team setup, no jobs appear.

Hypothesis and Question:

I’ve noticed that when HR assignments are made directly at the work center level, the jobs are displayed correctly.

This raises a few questions:

  • Are the teams defined in Manage Teams and Responsibilities (type MAINT_TEAM) implicitly or necessarily linked to HR data or should the job filter work without relying on HR assignments?

  • Is there a configuration step or mapping needed between MAINT_TEAM and HR objects (e.g., position, person, organizational unit)?

Thank you in advance for your insights or any experience you can share on this!

Best regards

entry.title: Employee Replication Status is 'Sent'
entry.content:
Hi,

While trying to replicate from EC to S/4, I noticed that the Status in Query in S/4 is set to "Sent". I have already asked our CPI team to check. However, they could not find any error from their end.

Has this already happened to any one? If yes, what is the root-cause and solution you have implemented.

Thank you.

entry.title: how does one create a story report to check alternative cost distribution with multiple cost centres
entry.content:
Dear colleagues, 

In story reporting, I want to create a formula that checks if the position cost centre matches either the 1 cost centre in alternative cost distribution portlet, OR 1 of multiple cost centres (preferably the one with the highest percentage) in alternative cost distribution portlet. 

I have been trying to set up this formula for a long time, but I cannot seem to succeed in doing so. Has anyone of you succeeded in doing so? And if yes, how did you set up the calculated column? 

thank you so much for your information.

Katrien

#reporting

entry.title: Employee Central Alerts: Limitation
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

Since SAP SuccessFactors introduced specific rule scenarios for configuring Business Rules, we now have the option to use the "Generate Employee Central Alerts" scenario to trigger alerts in EC.

However, I've encountered a limitation: it is not possible to use personal base objects —specifically, Dependent or Employee Information —within this rule scenario. This restriction prevents us from setting up alerts based on conditions such as "employee turns 65" or "dependent reaches 18 years old."

Has anyone found a workaround for this limitation? 

Thanks in advance for any suggestions!

entry.title: Poll: Are you registered for Success Connect?
entry.content:
If you are, give a kudos. If you're not, you can REGISTER HERE!

SAP Connect — our new annual event — is designed for business leaders and practitioners looking to maximize impact and resilience across their business in an unpredictable world. You’ll connect with peers and partners, experience live demos tailored to your priorities, and discover how SAP empowers you to move forward with confidence — no matter what lies ahead.

Success Connect

In-person event | October 6–8, 2025

Fontainebleau and Resorts World

Las Vegas, Nevada

 

Success Connect at SAP Connect showcases how the latest HR solutions from SAP help you build a workforce ready for what’s next.

  • Learn how AI-enabled HR solutions enable your teams to work smarter and faster.
  • See how SAP's cutting-edge HR innovations turn workforce data into enterprise-wide impact.
  • Explore skills-first talent strategies for building an empowered, resilient, agile workforce.

entry.title: Unify ECC and NetWeaver HCM during the S/4HANA conversion
entry.content:
Hello SAP Gurus,

I’m performing a brownfield conversion from ECC to S/4HANA, but the client also has a separate SAP HCM Standalone System with HCM, and they want to unify it into S/4HANA. How would this technical unification from ECC and NetWeaver HCM to S/4HANA be carried out?

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Sync of Onboarding users to Azure Active Directory before their hire date
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We have the Onboarding 2.0 module being rolled out but we have noticed that when any user is hired directly in EC (without onboarding module) - the user gets synced to Azure Active Directory perfectly fine. However if the user comes through Onboarding module, it does not sync to the Azure Active Directory. 

I have provided the permissions to the technical user from SF side and the target population includes both employees and external onboardees.

Can anyone please guide on what could be still missing for the onboardees to sync to Azure Active Directory? Is there any specific mapping that needs to be done on Azure side as well? The username field is not able to be fetched in the Azure Active Directory for users coming from Onboarding module.

Thanks in advance for your help.

entry.title: timesheet
entry.content:
Hello everyone,
I need help with the timesheet form. For an employee, the old working time model is still displayed in the Work Schedule field in the Personal/Organizational Data block, even though a new one was assigned in IT0007 as of July 1, 2025.

Could this be related to an incorrect data binding in the timesheet form?

If so, how can I check or change this?

Thank you for your feedback.

Barbara

entry.title: Delimit IT105 when Employee is Terminated via Replication program EC to S4
entry.content:

However, the delimiting of IT105 particularly System Username is not delimit.

Is there standard to delimit? Or suggestion of how to go about it?

Thanks.

entry.title: How to check error logs for CATS when transferred to PM or CO database
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I need you help in doing one analysis. I am describing the issue below:

We are posting the timesheet in CATS where the receiver is a PM order and then via a batch job we are transferring it to PM and CO data base but somehow the batch job got failed. The batch job only shows that it has been failed and no more error details. Due to this there are no entries in PM or CO while entries are displaying under the CATS time display and its database tables. I am wondering as we tick the 'Log (PM/HR/CO/PS)' box (refer attached screenshot) under the program variant (RCATSTAL), SAP should be saving these logs somewhere in the database. I have checked SLG1, IW46, COFC and CN30 but no luck.

Would be great if someone can advise.

Thanks,

Rahul
